member.name: T:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.CommerceTrackingAttribute
member.summary: Add this attribute to any controller or action that you want tracking requests to be sent for. The data for the tracking requests will be gathered from the current http request as well as the current .

member.name: M:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.CommerceTrackingAttribute.#ctor(EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.TrackingType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The type of tracking request should be sent.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.CommerceTrackingAttribute.Scope
member.summary: The tracking scope. This is used to segment tracking data. When used with EPiServer.Personalization.Commerce this can be used to separate data from different scopes into different personalization service accounts. Scopes are used in a similar way in Episerver profile store. If no scope is set when the tracking is sent, it will by default be set to the current Site Id.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.CommerceTrackingAttribute.SkipRecommendations
member.summary: Flag to indicate if tracking request should skip retrieval of recommendations.
member.value: true to exclude recommendations (track only), false to include recommendations (default).

member.summary: Creates tracking object.

member.summary: Processes tracking result.

member.summary: An optional ID to uniquely identify a cart for a specific user and session

member.summary: The base class for all types of commerce tracking data.

member.summary: The request type for this tracking request.

member.summary: The IP address of the client to be tracked.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceTrackingData.Session
member.summary: The ID of the current tracking session.
member.remarks: This ID is automatically stored and handled by the

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceTrackingData.Cuid
member.summary: The consolidated user ID for the current user.
member.remarks: This ID is automatically stored and handled by the

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceTrackingData.Site
member.summary: The name of the site submitting the tracking request.
member.remarks: This value is used to authorize the request to the tracking API. This value is automatically fetched from configuration.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceTrackingData.ClientToken
member.summary: The authorization token for the .
member.remarks: This value is used to authorize the request to the tracking API. This value is automatically fetched from configuration.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceTrackingData.Lang
member.summary: The code for the language in which the content is viewed.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceTrackingData.CurrentUri
member.summary: The URI for the page currently viewed by the client.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceTrackingData.PreviousUri
member.summary: The URI for the page previously viewed by the client, i.e. the UrlReferrer of the current .

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceTrackingData.EnableFeatures
member.summary: Data send to tracking service to enable/disable returning recommendation items. Should only be null or empty.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceUserData
member.summary: Holds information that uniquely identifies a user. Used to consolidate different sessions / CUIDs to a single user identity.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceUserData.Name
member.summary: The name of the user.
member.remarks: This information is not used, but is included for backwards compatibility. Will always be set to the same value as the Email property.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceUserData.Email
member.summary: The email address of the user.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceUserData.Id
member.summary: The pseudonymous ID of the user.
member.remarks: The user ID should be pseudonymous, so that it cannot be used to identify the person behind the user without combining the user ID with more information. E.g. an internal (random) numeric is OK, a user name or email address is not.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.DefaultScopeTrackingDataInterceptor.SortOrder
member.summary: The tracking interceptor sort order. All registered implementations are called in order, from lowest to highest.
member.remarks: As documented in the method of this class, this works as a fallback for when EPiServer.Tracking.Cms is not installed, but runs just before the interceptor in that package it to ensure consistent behavior when they are both installed.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.DefaultScopeTrackingDataInterceptor.Intercept``1(EPiServer.Tracking.Core.TrackingData{``0})
member.summary: Sets the property of to the string representation of the property of the current .
member.remarks: This interceptor has duplicates the functionality of an interceptor in the EPiServer.Tracking.Cms package, to ensure the same Scope behavior when that package is not installed.

member.summary: Extension methods for .

member.name: M:EPiServer.Tracking.Core.TrackingServiceExtensions.Track(EPiServer.Tracking.Core.ITrackingService,EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceTrackingData,System.Web.HttpContextBase,EPiServer.Core.IContent)
member.summary: Sends the tracking request and returns the response data, if applicable.
member.param: The content relating to the tracking action.
member.returns: The returned tracking response, if any, otherwise null.
member.remarks: For a result to be returned, all these preconditions must be met: - EPiServer.Personalization.Commerce has to be installed and have a configured endpoint. - Tracking must be enabled. - Tracking must be in server mode (not client mode). - The collection of must either be null or non-empty.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Tracking.Core.TrackingServiceExtensions.Track(EPiServer.Tracking.Core.ITrackingService,EPiServer.Tracking.Commerce.Data.CommerceTrackingData,System.Web.HttpContextBase,EPiServer.Core.IContent,System.String)
member.summary: Sends the tracking request and returns the response data, if applicable.
member.param: The content relating to the tracking action.

The tracking scope. This is used to segment tracking data. When used with EPiServer.Personalization.Commerce this can be used to separate data from different scopes into different personalization service accounts. Scopes are used in a similar way in Episerver profile store. If no scope is set when the tracking is sent, it will by default be set to the current Site Id.
member.returns: The returned tracking response, if any, otherwise null.
member.remarks: For a result to be returned, all these preconditions must be met: - EPiServer.Personalization.Commerce has to be installed and have a configured endpoint. - Tracking must be enabled. - Tracking must be in server mode (not client mode). - The collection of must either be null or non-empty.

member.summary: Sends the tracking request and returns the response data, if applicable.
member.param: The content name relating to the tracking action.
